intro: Espeletia colombiana, commonly known as the "Colombian torch cactus," is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It is characterized by its dense, spiny stems and large, showy flower heads that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and páramo ecosystems. Its structure is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds. Espeletia colombiana plays a vital role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
